definition: to promote to a higher job/to select for promotion
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: The queen made him officer of the guard.
sentences.chinese: 女王陛下提拔他为卫队长。

sentences.english: The upper minimizing eyelids from the corner of the eye to eye end oblique upper direction sprelisting; helps improve skin.
sentences.chinese: 高低眼睑从眼角至眼尾斜上方向抹开，帮手提拔肌肤。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, conservative power-broker Roy Cohn (Al Pacino), who gave Joe the offer of promotion, is dying of AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 同时，提拔乔的保守权力掮客洛伊正为爱滋病所苦。

sentences.english: The upper minimizing eyelids from the corner of the eye to eye end oblique upper direction sprepost: helps improve skin.
sentences.chinese: 高低眼睑从眼角至眼尾斜上方向抹开，辅助提拔肌肤。

sentences.english: Pleasant with the good news, Emperor Wu promoted Chen as a reward.
sentences.chinese: 汉武帝很高兴，就提拔陈步乐为郎官。

sentences.english: At last, the first was promoted to be the principal of the sub-company.
sentences.chinese: 最终，第一个人被提拔为分公司负责人。

sentences.english: The news of my promotion is an unexpected joy.
sentences.chinese: 我获得提拔的消息真是喜从天降。

sentences.english: He was inflated with pride since he was promoted.
Hongfa promoted the liberal do personal assistant.
sentences.chinese: 鸿发提拔博雅做了私人助理。

sentences.english: The upper minimizing eyelids from the corner of the eye to eye end oblique upper direction spreadvertising chereaspaign helps improve skin.
sentences.chinese: 高低眼睑从眼角至眼尾斜上方向抹开，匡助提拔肌肤。

sentences.english: Employers say they are more likely to promote well-dressed workers.
sentences.chinese: 雇主们说他们更有可能提拔穿着体面的员工。

sentences.english: Jane is buttering up the new director to gain promotion.
sentences.chinese: 珍在讨好新来的主任，为了是能得到提拔。

sentences.english: A college or university teacher who ranks above an associate professor.
sentences.chinese: 他那所学院破格提拔他当副教授。

sentences.english: Increasingly aware of the prospect emerging from Rovers Academy, Sam Allardyce soon picked Jones.
sentences.chinese: 他在布莱克本越来越出色，大山姆很快就提拔了琼斯。

sentences.english: His college gave him accelerated promotion to Associate Professor.
sentences.chinese: 他那所学校破格提拔他当副教授。

sentences.english: Fred is promoted to be the assistant of manager in marketing department and David to be director of office.
sentences.chinese: 佛瑞德被提拔为市场部经理助理，大卫为办公室主任。

definition: to put in an important position
select the best people for promotion
to appreciate/to recognize the worth of sth/appreciation
to regard sth as valuable/to think highly of (a younger person, a subordinate etc)
to lead by the hand/to guide/to support
to promote to a higher position
to break the rule/to make an exception
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
